TextView.android:text: Formation Of The Universe- 13.8 Billion years ago \n

This event is known as the Big Bang, which involved the emergence of all the matter in the universe from a single, minuscule point in a violent burst. Expanding at an astoundingly high speed, its size doubled every 10-34 seconds, causing the creation of space due to its rapid inflation. Gravity and all other forces were formed within a fraction of a second and energy changed into particles of matter and antimatter, which largely destroyed each other. However, some matter survived and protons and neutrons began to form in the first second, which then could fuse into hydrogen and helium nuclei within minutes. The universe then filled clouds of hydrogen and helium gas 300,000 years later as the nuclei could finally capture electrons to form atoms. Another 80,000 years later, it left behind a bath of photons, which formed the Cosmic Microwave Background which was accidentally detected by Penzias and Wilson. Tiny ripples of matter were within these and they stretched to enormous sizes during inflation, becoming the seeds for the galaxies and galactic clusters we see today. (“Big Bang: How the Universe Was Created”)
